Description/Examples: Total population, male/female split, age groups (under 5, 5–17, 18–64, 65+), single-year age breakdowns
White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, multiracial; crossed with sex or age
High school, some college, bachelor's, graduate degree; split by gender, race, age (25+)
Household median income, per capita, income brackets, quartiles, poverty rates, by family type/race
Owner-occupied vs renter-occupied, mortgage status, home value ranges, monthly costs, rooms, year built
Unemployment rate, occupation types, industry, commute time, labor force participation
Marital status, household size, presence of children, family vs non-family households
Coverage by type (employer, Medicare, Medicaid), uninsured rate, by age/income
English proficiency, Spanish/Asian/Other languages at home, by age
Vehicles available, commute method (car, public transit, bike), time to work
Broadband subscription, no internet, device ownership, by household type
Hearing, vision, cognitive, ambulatory difficulty; by age group
Veteran status, service period, by gender/age
Foreign-born, citizenship, year of entry, moved in last year
Core variables most people pull for analysis
